title: What if there was another universe before the Big Bang and our universe at present was created from the destruction of that universe? - Quora

response.answer_text: That is one of the many different cosmological theories of the Big Bang. One particular older variant of this is the so-called “Big Crunch” theory, where the universe expands, and then starts to fall in on itself because of gravity, into a so-called “Big Crunch”, and then explodes again in another Big Bang, creating a new universe. Science fiction and comic book writers have explored this idea a lot since the 1950’s, including James Blish in the Cities in Flight series, and Stan Lee and Jack Kirby with the origins of Galactus. I think modern physics has more or less ruled out the Big Crunch as a possibility, because gravity isn’t strong enough. But it’s still an intriguing possibility. Big Crunch - Wikipedia
